title: Infrastructure Engineer
description:
Who are we?

We provide products and services that are already improving the operational delivery of rail services. Our vision is to create a truly connected rail network, using our deep technology expertise and rail industry experience to deliver game-changing solutions that improve the quality of transport across the UK and beyond. We are a company that is excited by the possibilities offered by technology and are driven by improving experiences for passengers globally.

We have consistently innovated to create a best in the market product, delivering high levels of automation into complex operational environments. We continue to evolve our offer and recently integrated our technology with our own Traffic Management System; an operational and technical first. Our service offer continues to grow, taking advantage of technologies including cloud and data analytics.

To make this happen, we are seeking a highly skilled and versatile Infrastructure Engineer (to join our DevOps team) with a strong background in Linux servers (Ubuntu/Redhat) and AWS cloud to join our dynamic infrastructure team. You will play a pivotal role in ensuring the seamless operation, optimization, and automation of our application stack.

What are the key objectives?

  • Ensure our on-prem infrastructure and AWS cloud estate are ready and available to support our teams, digital services, and customers at all times
  • Provision environments and services that are used by our customers as well as our development, engineering, and test teams
  • Assist in deploying product updates, locating production errors, and building integrations that improve users’ experience
  • Create, manage, and maintain the Infrastructure as Code for the project, deploy and update docker stacks to a docker swarm, ensuring lab configurations as well as involvement in updating, rolling back the product version etc. This work is approximately 80% on-prem and 20% cloud based

Requirements

Personally, we are looking for:

  • An excellent problem-solver who shows initiative to deliver on their promises
  • A team player, not afraid to step out of their role where it is best for the team
  • Someone who is assured and approachable, able to build relationships and collaborate with others
  • Someone highly motivated, organised and able to manage their workload and commitments
  • A technical background with a keen attention to detail
    • Comprehensive communication skills

Technically, we are looking for someone who can hit the ground running, bring valuable insights and has demonstrated experience of:

  • Environment/Infrastructure Management, including provisioning and support for hardware, software, data, and network
  • Systems Administration Support, Security; User management; Upgrades/Patching; Scripting / Process Automation e.g. Ansible; Monitoring and System Analytics
  • Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment

Great to have, but not essential:

  • Worked with AWS Cloud services such as EC2 and S3, using CloudFormation and Terraform.
  • YAML based Azure DevOps pipelines.
  • Understanding of JSON language
  • AWS SysOps and Cloud Architecture Certifications
  • Advocate for DevOps culture and practices with Product and Project teams
  • Manage work items in Agile delivery lifecycle including updates to work items and active participation in ceremonies

Benefits

So that you can thrive both in and out of work we offer the following benefits on top of a competitive salary that rewards you for the value you bring:

  • Flexible working with a minimum requirement of one day in the office each week.
  • 27 days annual leave in addition to public holidays.
  • 3 “privilege days” scheduled between Christmas/New Year.
  • Pension plan with matched contributions from 5%-8%.
  • Private Healthcare that covers you and your immediate dependents.
  • Group Income Protection cover.
  • Life Assurance.
  • Enhanced maternity, paternity, and adoption policies.
  • Monthly divisional days that bring the whole team together.
  • Tailored and supported training and development to further your career.

This role could be based in Derby, Milton Keynes, or London. We have a flexible, hybrid approach to work and work location - so please talk to us about your preferences and how these could work for both you and the team. We do require everyone to be in one of our offices at least once a week. We provide this flexibility to enable you to work most effectively.

title: Marketing Executive
description:
Performance Marketing Executive | Salary: £25-£30,000 per year

Company Profile;

Dedicated to bridging the gap between brands and their customers by harnessing first-party data and helping to deliver stand-out brand experiences with the creation of beautifully functional websites, customer journeys, and marketing strategies to captivate and engage the audiences of some extremely interesting and leading brands in their specific industries.

From Strategy & insight, UX & Design, Development, E-commerce, and Digital Marketing you’d have a hand in managing the entire process of a brands digital asset creation from inception to completion.

The Role;

As Performance Marketing Executive you’ll be using data-driven strategies to reach the right audiences, at the right time, on the right channel. Working with the Head of Marketing Services to ensure clients find their new customers in the most effective way whilst meeting their business KPIs and responding to marketing insights.

Seamless relationship management with agency partners is a big part of the role, making sure that you reach the best outcomes possible, with the support of your colleagues. Reporting and insight are also essential to this position, therefore you’d need to be confident presenting your data-led solutions and then back the insights obtained from your campaigns, testing, and optimisation.

Key Channels we’d need you to be well versed on;

· Meta Suite of platforms

· Google Suite of platforms

· TikTok

· Pinterest

Skills Required;

· Hands-on experience creating digital marketing campaigns, with use of Facebook Ads Manager and Google ads.

· Budget management

· Open-minded to new developments and platforms

· Experience of analytic tools such as Google Analytics and Looker studio

· Proven experience working in line with KPIs, such as traffic, CPC, CPA, ROAS, and conversion rate.

· An analytical mindset with the ability to interpret data and performance metrics and present results, liaising with other leads to consider solutions.

· A collaborative attitude and willingness to learn.

· Excellent planning and organisational skills, with the ability to multitask and prioritise across multiple projects.

· Able to meet tight deadlines, coordinate workload, and remain calm under pressure.

· Excellent communication skills both in writing and verbal. You should have the ability to take the complex and distil it to our clients in layman’s terms that they can follow.

Nice to Have’s:

· A solid understanding of SEO

· Experienced in optimising business panels

· Experience in the property industry

· Experience of working with Rightmove and Zoopla

· Experience of advertising on Reddit

· CRM / Email marketing

· Experience in using generative AI

Benefits, allowances, and additional Information;

· 25 Days Holiday per year plus bank holidays

· Annual Performance related bonus

· Planting trees and funding the world’s best climate crisis solutions to offset carbon emissions of team members.

· A Macbook.

· Option to work flexible hours – core hours are 10am-5pm.

· Herman Miller chairs (say goodbye to back pain).

· Whatever tools you need to do an amazing job for your clients.

· Huge opportunities to learn and develop through professional qualifications, as well as exposure to incredible projects, and informal lunch and learns hosted by your colleagues.

· Regular team events and Socials.

· Annual away day – A chance to celebrate the years successes with your colleagues.

· If you’re a cyclist, a safe place to store your bike.

**The office is also a short walk from a train station so is commutable via public transport.**

When applying for this role please state where you’re currently based, which locations you are happy to commute to, and upload a Microsoft Word version of your CV excluding imagery.

For more information search Initiate Resourcing on LinkedIn and Twitter or www.initiateresourcing.co.uk to see more of our latest jobs, industry news, tips, and more, alternatively please call one of our consultants on 07398 612341.

  • Work from home

  • Agency: 2 years (preferred)

title: Software Engineer
description:
About the business:
LexisNexis Risk Solutions is the essential partner in the assessment of risk. Within our Insurance vertical, we provide customers with solutions and decision tools that combine public and industry specific content with advanced technology and analytics to assist them in evaluating and predicting risk and enhancing operational efficiency. Our insurance risk solutions help drive better data-driven decisions across the insurance policy lifecycle – all while reducing risk. You can learn more about LexisNexis Risk at the link below.
https://risk.lexisnexis.com/insurance

About our team:
  • We are focused on building high quality software to meet the challenges of our industry, creating systems to serve transactions at high volume to our business partners.
  • We create teams of innovative, enthusiastic software engineers to build systems to transform our industry.
  • We use a variety of technologies and are creating our next generation of services based on microservice architecture.
About the job:
  • This is a hands-on coding role, part of a cross functional team, working with other developers, quality, and operations engineers.
  • You’ll be working on the development of new products and product enhancements, delivering multiple different sources of data to our customers.
  • You'll be involved with design, documentation, support and implementation of new microservices as well as maintaining the current services.
You’ll be responsible for:
  • Interface with other technical personnel or team members to finalize requirements.
  • Write and review of detailed specifications for the development of system.
  • Work closely with other development team members to understand product requirements and translate them into software designs.
  • Successfully implement development processes, coding best practices, and code reviews.
  • Implementing Agile processes, tools, and techniques to build efficiency, deliver value and shape best-practice in collaboration with key stakeholders.
  • Completing bug fixes and resolving technical issues to ensure quality and performance.
  • Levelling up our engineering practices by mentoring engineers, sharing knowledge and learning across our organization.
  • Keep abreast of new technology developments.
  • All other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
  • Java Development experience
  • Spring Boot framework experience
  • Web Services (SOAP, RESTful)
  • Test Driven Development
  • Ability to work well with internal and external technology resources.
  • Keen to learn new technology and adapt to change.
  • Strong written and oral communication skill
  • Good team player, interactive, be able to work well with other team members.
  • Creative, problem solver, innovative, can actively participate to give ideas / solutions.
  • Being able to help other team members.
  • Degree in Computer Science, related discipline, or relevant experience
Preferred skills:
  • Kubernetes / Docker
  • Github workflow
  • AWS, incl Terraform.
  • Agile / SCRUM
  • PHP, SQL, XML
Women in technology:
LexisNexis® Risk Solutions is very supportive of women in Technology and has been a founding signature for the Tech Talent Charter. Currently 26.2% of our Technology workforce are women which is much higher than the UK average of 17%. We have the following initiatives in place to support women in technology:
  • Mentoring scheme for women in technology
  • Women’s network forum
  • Regularly run events for schools girl about careers in technology to inspire the next generation of girls in tech.
Culture and benefits:
Learn more about the LexisNexis Risk team and how we work
here
#LI-Hybrid
#LI-SJ1
At LexisNexis Risk Solutions, having diverse employees with different perspectives is key to creating innovative new products for our global customers. We have 30 diversity employee networks globally and prioritize inclusive leadership and equitable processes as part of our culture. Our aim is for every employee to be the best version of themselves. We would actively welcome applications from candidates of diverse backgrounds and underrepresented groups.
We are committed to providing a fair and accessible hiring process. If you have a disability or other need that requires accommodation or adjustment, please let us know by completing our Applicant Request Support Form:
https://forms.office.com/r/eVgFxjLmAK
.
Please read our
Candidate Privacy Policy
.

title: Machine Specialist
description:
Diverse community. Inclusive Research. Rewarding Careers.

Doing things differently.


Machine Learning Specialist for Financial Data Quality (KTP Associate)

£45k - £50k (per annum)

Fixed term contract for 28 months

In-person working in Nottingham City Centre location, with some remote opportunities

Interview date: 6th March 2024 (in person)

About the Role

In today's world, where data plays a big role, having high-quality data is particularly important. It helps us get accurate insights and make better decisions. While current solutions in the market can identify data quality issues based on pre-defined rules, these approaches are limited and incapable of correcting these errors, supported by a set of confidence measures to ensure the accuracy of the corrected entries. The aim of this exciting KTP project between Nottingham Trent University and Bigspark Limited is to revolutionize the way organisations handle and leverage their data by employing innovative techniques based on Artificial Intelligence to perform data imputation and correction. This will empower businesses with high-quality, accurate and timely data for effective decision-making.

The expected outcome of this project are as follows:

  • Develop innovative AI/ML solution for identifying data quality issues.
  • Integrate the developed solution to existing platforms to improve data quality by identifying outliers and possible corrective measures.
  • Develop explainable AI models to improve transparency and trust of the developed solutions.
  • Embed the technical knowledge into the company and develop a knowledge for future adaptation of the project outcomes

The overall purpose of the KTP associate role is to lead the successful development and integration ML-based data quality enhancement solution that is applicable in the financial sector. This will allow BigSpark to utilise this tool as part of their development toolchain, resulting in an efficient and timely data correction measures.

Who is bigspark?

Bigspark is a fast-growing UK data solutions consultancy transforming businesses and igniting

change through engineering and data-fuelled innovation. Our agile team of over 50 data engineers

and scientists approaches complex challenges with an audacious mindset, pushing boundaries to

unlock the power within data.

We proudly offer our services to leading organizations in finance like NatWest, Esure, and in

mental health, like MyNara. We are constantly pushing our expertise forward across data

engineering, science, AI, cloud, software, and financial crime technology. For each client, our

dedicated teams get deep into the details of their business to deliver top-notch tailored solutions.

Leveraging our extensive experience serving financial sector clients, we aim to use our data

quality expertise to solve critical problems such as improving the accuracy and completeness of

financial data, which is one of the main causes of poor decision making that can lead to

significant financial losses or compliance issues for organizations.

Most data quality solutions tend to have a narrow focus, with limited capabilities to address

emerging data quality issues like bias or concept drift; and also lack automation. With many tools

to select from, each with different value offerings, selecting a tool can be very difficult, and the

one eventually chosen may not achieve the expected results.

We intend to approach this problem more holistically by expanding the scope and changing the

approach to data quality with the aim of implementing real-time machine learning-driven data profiling, monitoring, and augmentation.


About KTPs:

This position forms part of a Knowledge Transfer Partnership (KTP) funded jointly by Innovate UK and BigSpark Ltd. As a KTP Associate you will work within BigSpark Ltd to develop and embed knowledge, with research and academic support from NTU. This KTP offers the ideal opportunity to apply your degree through real work and springboard your career. It includes a £4.6k training budget & 10% of your time dedicated to your own personal development. Read more about the scheme here: www.ktp-uk.org

More information:

Questions? We recommend you get in touch with Dr Salisu Yahaya, Senior Lecturer at Nottingham Trent University salisu.yahaya@ntu.ac.uk

Please note if you’re applying for this position, you should not have previously been employed as a KTP Associate.

Safe and Inclusive

At NTU, we continue to build an inclusive culture that encourages, supports and celebrates the diverse voices and experiences of our students and colleagues. We welcome the unique contributions that you can bring and we encourage people from underrepresented communities and backgrounds to apply to join our team.

Applications from job seekers who require sponsorship to work in the UK are welcome and will be considered alongside all other applications.

Whilst this role is eligible for sponsorship under the Skilled Worker Route, we recommend that you assess your eligibility before applying for this position. Visit https://www.gov.uk/skilled-worker-visa for more information.

This role is covered by the Rehabilitation of Offenders Act (1974) and successful applicants will be asked to declare any unspent criminal convictions.

title: Product Manager
description:
We are on a mission to improve the world of work, technology and people, building products and services to help solve our customers’ people-related challenges now and in the future.

We design software to make processes easier, create apps to foster engagement, support organisations to get better insights from their data and much more for over 1200 organisations across the UK and Ireland.

Our 4-core values Sustainability, Trust, Collaboration and Innovation have been the drive to MHR’s success. This starts internally within our business by putting our colleagues and customers at the forefront of everything we do.

Be part of our mission, join MHR and help shape the world of work.

A new opportunity has arisen to join MHR as a Product Manager who will lead a team of our established Analytics Product Owners in the road map delivery of new and existing Data, Analytics and AI solutions.

As a Product Manager your role includes managing the internal stakeholders but also creating the opportunity to add value for our customers. You will report directly to the Product Design Director and work efficiently together to deliver our ambitious roadmap.

This is a role where you can strive and add value with ample opportunity for career progression.

Key Responsibilities for MHR’s Product Manager

  • Own the execution of the Analytics Product Road Map in line with MHR vision and strategy.
  • Lead a team of Analytics Product Owners for new and existing product development
  • Drive the product related SLAs in conjunction with Product Owners
  • Manage and control analytics product backlogs with PO’s and ensure sprint planning is in line with release schedules.
  • Collaborate and build relationships with various stakeholders to deliver on the objectives and goals of the Analytics products including Marketing, Research, Developers, Solution Architects, UX/UI, Training and SLT’s
  • Plan and co-ordinate customer panels and pilots
  • Manage the planning of designs and story boards for solutions, working with UX/UI Team on more detailed designs.
  • Continuously apply product best practice and acts as an advocate for an analytics product line, providing guidance, training, and advice to others in the organisation.
  • Complete market analysis/research, competitor analysis and customer engagement to identify new opportunities and maintain with up-to-date knowledge on data, analytics, and AI.
  • Produce and oversee detailed feasibility and foundations documentation for MHR Development team

Key Skills and Experience

  • 2 or more years of experience as a Product Owner
  • Experience in Agile Delivery methodology
  • Previous experience in SaaS (Desirable)
  • Technical understanding of data, analytics, and AI technologies (Desirable)
  • Proven ability to create a vision for a product
  • Good understanding of product roadmap management
  • Highly Skilled in engaging with stakeholders
  • Excellent communication skills

What you’ll get in return:

With a great working environment and amazing colleagues, we’ll support you professionally and personally through our learning and wellbeing programmes. In addition, we offer:

  • Competitive salaries
  • Option to buy additional holiday days
  • Voluntary benefits scheme, ranging from private medical insurance to dental schemes
  • Access to over 60 internal training courses, plus the ability to study for professional qualifications
  • Coaching and mentoring programmes
  • Discounted gym memberships
  • Access to a GP 24/7, via SmartHealth
  • Discounts and cash back on leisure, travel, technology, fashion and food
  • Employee recognition programme
  • Social events, including running clubs, 5-a-side football teams and more
  • Subsidised restaurants across all sites, with a choice of fresh meals from our chefs each dayJob description

We are on a mission to improve the world of work, technology and people, building products and services to help solve our customers’ people-related challenges now and in the future.

We design software to make processes easier, create apps to foster engagement, support organisations to get better insights from their data and much more for over 1200 organisations across the UK and Ireland.

Our 4-core values Sustainability, Trust, Collaboration and Innovation have been the drive to MHR’s success. This starts internally within our business by putting our colleagues and customers at the forefront of everything we do.

Be part of our mission, join MHR and help shape the world of work.

Product Manager to work with our established Analytics Product Owners in the delivery of the Analytics product road map with the development of new and existing Data, Analytics and Artificial Intelligence solutions in order to maximise revenue potential and maintain competitive advantage. If you have experience of working with SaaS, producing fantastic analytics products and are based around Nottingham, we would love to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities:

  • Oversee the creation and production of analytics business cases, requirements and designs in conjunction with the Product Owners for new and existing product development
  • Provide line management to the Analytics Product Owner team
  • Manage and control analytics product backlogs with PO’s and ensure sprint planning is in line with release schedules in conjunction with the Chief Product Officer
  • Own the execution of an analytics product line on the MHR product roadmap and drive the future vision for this product line
  • Own the Analytics product roadmap and update in line with forecasted MHR core product release schedules
  • Facilitate regular updates to Chief Product Officer, Director of Analytics and wider SLT on analytics product development progress and forecasted analytics product roadmaps
  • Produce and oversee detailed feasibility and foundations documentation for MHR Development team
  • Manage and control all analytics product related SLAs in conjunction with Product Owners
  • Assess the feasibility of using new technologies in solution development with solutions architects
  • Utilise market research to produce and refine analytics product requirements.
  • Provide advice and guidance to the Development team throughout the development of solutions, acting as the voice of the customer in the review of analytics products to ensure they are fit for initial MVP release
  • Manage the planning of high-level designs and story boards for solutions, working with the UX/UI team on more detailed designs where needed
  • Work closely with the Research and Development teams on proof of concept studies for new technologies and approaches where needed
  • Research and maintain up to date knowledge on the data, analytics and artificial intelligence market, some of which will involve desk research or attending events
  • Interact and collaborate with the Product Marketing function for the promotion of new products, features enhancements and fixes for use in the development of portfolios and communications
  • Manage the preparation of analytics product documentation, including User Guides and Impact Analysis information
  • Act as an advocate for an analytics product line, providing guidance, training and advice to others in the organisation
  • Collaborate with the training department to plan analytics product external training courses
  • Plan and co-ordinate customer panels and pilots
  • Engage closely with marketing department for the creation of marketing collateral including Go to Market kits and sales enablement documentation
  • Complete market analysis to assess the commercial and technical feasibility of new ideas for new and existing products and services

Key Skills:

  • Specification and refinement of analytics product requirements
  • Strategic development of analytics product roadmaps
  • Technical understanding of data, analytics and artificial intelligence technologies
  • Communication skills
  • Product Team mentoring and development

What you’ll get in return:

With a great working environment and amazing colleagues, we’ll support you professionally and personally through our learning and wellbeing programmes. In addition, we offer:

  • Competitive salaries
  • Option to buy additional holiday days
  • Voluntary benefits scheme, ranging from private medical insurance to dental schemes
  • Access to over 60 internal training courses, plus the ability to study for professional qualifications
  • Coaching and mentoring programmes
  • Discounted gym memberships
  • Access to a GP 24/7, via SmartHealth
  • Discounts and cash back on leisure, travel, technology, fashion and food
  • Employee recognition programme
  • Social events, including running clubs, 5-a-side football teams and more
  • Subsidised restaurants across all sites, with a choice of fresh meals from our chefs each day

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • Holidays
  • Monday to Friday
  • No weekends

Application question(s):

  • Will you now or in the future require visa sponsorship?
  • Are you comfortable working in a hybrid setting? (3 days in the office and 2 days working from home in Nottingham, Ruddington)

Experience:

  • Product management: 1 year (preferred)
  • Agile Methodologies: 1 year (preferred)
  • SaaS: 1 year (preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Warehouse Lead
description:
Nottingham Trent House (95002), United Kingdom, Nottingham, Nottinghamshire

Incident and Problem Team Lead

Incident and Problem Manager Team Lead

About this role

Reporting to the Technology Operations Centre (TOC) Manager, you will be responsible for the Team managing, documenting and communicating all major Incidents and Problems to extremely high standards and in line with Enterprise processes across AWS and on-prem environments in support of Capital One’s UK business.

You will perform people leadership responsibilities for three Incident and Problem Managers. Building a highly motivated and engaged team will be fundamental to your success in this role as you support the development of your Team members in a changing technology landscape.


The TOC is a 24*7*365 operation with online presence between 08:00-17:30 and on-call coverage providing out of hours support. You will be required to perform Incident Management on call cover on rotation.

What you’ll do

  • People leadership for three Incident and Problem Managers
  • Team adherence to Enterprise Incident & Problem processes
  • Supporting Team members in their personal development, service and process improvement objectives
  • TOC operational toolset adoption and rollout to meet the needs of the UK Business
  • Lead major and critical Incident investigations through management, coordination and appropriate challenge of technical resources on a 24*7*365 basis.
  • Coordination and leadership of office based and virtual support teams
  • Monitoring the overall execution and health of Incident Management and Problem Management activities and compiling Incident and Problem based reporting
  • Identifying Service trends through effective root cause analysis, and driving initiatives across Tech to provide corrective actions
  • Additional responsibilities include TOC operational toolset adoption and rollout, Incident and Problem reporting as well as ownership of the TOC Onboarding initiative to drive the correct Incident and Problem engagement behaviours from our Support, SRE, and Engineering Teams.
  • You will be liaising closely with our Business Partners, internal Technology teams, and real-time engagement with suppliers and sourcing partners to effectively manage Incidents and Problems impacting our business.


What we’re looking for

  • Strong experience in a People Leadership role. We want to hear all about your successes in leading teams and developing associates.
  • Strong experience of working in a Major Incident or Service Management role
  • Exceptional communication skills and the ability to display a flexible problem solving approach.
  • Able to work and remain calm in a pressured environment, demonstrating great situational leadership across multiple teams and stakeholders
  • Experience in handling large IT incidents, ideally within the Financial Services sector
  • Ability to communicate openly and effectively in both written and verbal form, confident meeting with internal and external Senior stakeholders
  • ITIL Foundation qualification preferable
  • A basic understanding of Tech application and infrastructure terminology, along with entry level understanding of the principles of AWS Cloud technologies

Where and how you'll work

This is a permanent position and is based in our Nottingham offices. We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working model - one that creates the opportunity to work in your own way, but also provides great spaces for in-person collaboration.

Our core in-the-office days are Tuesday to Thursday - you’ll be led by your team, the type of work you do and of course your preferences. Many of our team have flexible working patterns so we’re open to discuss flexible working arrangements with you.

We are committed to creating a level playing field and seek to create teams that are representative of our customers and the communities we serve. We’d love to hear from you if you identify with a typically under-represented group in our industry and are particularly keen to hear from women and ethnic minority candidates.

What you should know about how we recruit

We pride ourselves on hiring the best people, not the same people. Building diverse and inclusive teams is the right thing to do and the smart thing to do. We want to work with top talent: whoever you are, whatever you look like, wherever you come from. We know it’s about what you do, not just what you say. That’s why we make our recruitment process fair and accessible. And we offer benefits that attract people at all ages and stages.

We also partner with organisations including the Women in Finance and Race At Work Charters, Stonewall and upReach to find people from every walk of life and help them thrive with us. We have a whole host of internal networks and support groups you could be involved in, to name a few:

  • REACH – Race Equality and Culture Heritage group focuses on representation, retention and engagement for associates from minority ethnic groups and allies
  • OutFront – to provide LGBTQ+ support for all associates
  • Mind Your Mind – signposting support and promoting positive mental wellbeing for all
  • Women in Tech – promoting an inclusive environment in tech
  • EmpowHER - network of female associates and allies focusing on developing future leaders, particularly for female talent in our industry

Capital One is committed to diversity in the workplace.

If you require a reasonable adjustment, please contact ukrecruitment@capitalone.com All information will be kept confidential and will only be used for the purpose of applying a reasonable adjustment.

For technical support or questions about Capital One's recruiting process, please send an email to Careers@capitalone.com

Capital One does not provide, endorse nor guarantee and is not liable for third-party products, services, educational tools or other information available through this site.

Capital One Financial is made up of several different entities. Please note that any position posted in Canada is for Capital One Canada, any position posted in the United Kingdom is for Capital One Europe and any position posted in the Philippines is for Capital One Philippines Service Corp. (COPSSC).


Who We Are

At Capital One, we're building a leading information-based technology company. Still founder-led by Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Richard Fairbank, Capital One is on a mission to help our customers succeed by bringing ingenuity, simplicity, and humanity to banking. We measure our efforts by the success our customers enjoy and the advocacy they exhibit. We are succeeding because they are succeeding.

Guided by our shared values, we thrive in an environment where collaboration and openness are valued. We believe that innovation is powered by perspective and that teamwork and respect for each other lead to superior results. We elevate each other and obsess about doing the right thing. Our associates serve with humility and a deep respect for their responsibility in helping our customers achieve their goals and realize their dreams. Together, we are on a quest to change banking for good.

title: Digital Forensics Software Engineer - Advanced Data Acquisition Team
Machine learning Implementation Manager,, Strategic Analytics Services

Product Owner
description:
Dynamics Architect and Product Owner

UK BASED CANDIDATES ONLY WITH RIGHT TO WORK IN UK

PERMANENT - HYBRID - NOTTINGHAM

SALARY: £65,000 - £82,300 (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

We are looking for an IT Security Specialist to join our IT & Digital Department on a permanent basis. This is a hybrid role with the office location being in Nottingham City Centre paying £65,279 to £82,382 along with a market leading benefit package.

Here's what you'll be doing

The Microsoft Dynamics Architect will be responsible for owning the technical direction and strategy for all applications built using Microsoft Dynamics within the UK Solutions area.

They will be a technical owner for all decisions within Microsoft Dynamics, guiding our partners to ensure they make the correct decisions and ensuring that documentation is kept up to date.

The Microsoft Dynamics Architect will oversee and provide technical leadership to our partners in the areas of technical design, development, security and operations.

Responsibilities

  • Own the Microsoft Dynamics technical direction and strategy for ensuring it aligns with the wider company strategies.
  • Work closely with our strategic partners to ensure that the correct decisions are made about Microsoft Dynamics, providing guidance and technical expertise where necessary.
  • Collaborate with other architects and stakeholders to design, develop, and implement solutions using Microsoft Dynamics.
  • Ensure that documentation is kept up to date and accurate.
  • Define and maintain best practices and standards for Microsoft Dynamics architecture and design.
  • Establish and maintain an architecture roadmap and principles that are aligned with industry best practices.
  • Ensure that the solutions are scalable, reliable, and secure.
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to developers and other team members working on behalf of our partners.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot issues, ensuring that they are resolved in a timely and effective manner.
  • Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in Microsoft Dynamics and provide recommendations for improvement.

*

What we need from you

Essential

  • Strong background in the technical understanding of Microsoft Dynamics
  • Experience working within a DevOps & Agile environment
  • Strong technical leadership and communication skills
  • Experience of building secure, robust and resilient applications using Microsoft Dynamics.
  • Experience with the Power Platform and its capabilities to resolve business problems without causing wider impacts.
  • Experience working within a multi partner / vendor environment

Desirable

  • Experience of different CRM platforms and their capabilities.
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure) and related tasks
  • Experience of Identity & Access Management solutions and how they operate alongside Microsoft Dynamics
  • Understanding of the ITIL framework and how it can be adapted to suit DevOps
  • Accreditation in agile and/or DevOps methodologies

title: Digital Forensic Hardware Engineer - Advanced Data Acquisition Team
Software Test Engineer
description:
Test & Automation Manager
Here's what you'll be doing

The Test and Automation Manager will be responsible for defining and maintaining the test and test automation strategies.

Additionally, they will be responsible for overseeing & co-ordinating the end-to-end testing activities performed by our partners across a multi team, DevOps / DevSecOps model. This includes system testing, system integration testing, security testing and performance testing.

The Test & Automation Manager will also be responsible for driving the automation testing strategy and working with our suppliers to ensure that the coverage remains high for automation testing.

Responsibilities

  • Develop, implement and maintain the overall test strategy for the UK Solutions organisation.
  • Coordinate with our partners to ensure that testing is carried out in accordance with the agreed test strategy.
  • Develop and maintain a testing framework within a DevOps / DevSecOps model that is efficient and effective.
  • Develop and implement a test automation strategy to improve the overall efficiency and effectiveness of the testing process.
  • Co-ordinate the process for security testing & performance testing.
  • Identify and implement best practices and standards for testing and test automation.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional DevOps teams to identify and prioritize testing requirements for new features, functionality, and system changes.
  • Work with our partners and suppliers to develop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts.
  • Continuously monitor and communicate the progress of testing efforts to stakeholders.
  • Provide guidance and support to our partners during testing to ensure the highest level of quality is maintained.
  • Work with the DevOps team to ensure that software is designed and developed with testability in mind.
What we need from you

Essential

  • Established leader in software testing, with a focus on automation testing
  • Strong understanding of DevOps / DevSecOps
  • Strong understanding of the agile delivery methodology
  • Strong knowledge of software testing methodologies, tools, and techniques
  • Experience in developing and maintaining a test automation framework
  • Experience using automation testing tools and techniques
  • Experience in coordinating system testing activities across a multi team environment
  • Strong understanding of secure by design concepts and how this can be assured with automation testing.
  • Ability to analyse, report and communicate to a verity of different stakeholders the progress of test results
  • Experience managing penetration & performance testing
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills
  • Strong leadership and decision-making skills

Desirable

  • Experience using Business Driven Development techniques (BDD)
  • Experience using Cucumber and other automation testing frameworks
  • Accreditation in agile and / or DevOps methodologies
  • Experience of Low Code / No Code technologies (e.g. Microsoft Dynamics)
  • Experience of serverless cloud solutions (e.g. Azure functions/ AWS Lambdas)
  • Experience with API level testing with an integration platform (e.g. MuleSoft)
  • Experience of automation testing within a cloud native architecture

Here’s what you need to know

Our market-leading benefits package includes 26 days holiday + bank holidays, a generous pension scheme, life cover, bonus and the chance to choose from 20 flexible benefits with tax and/or NI savings. In fact, our benefits package recently won the Personnel Today Reward, Recognition and Benefits Award 2022!

As the only energy company to feature in The Inclusive Top 50 UK Employers (our 2022/23 ranking is 15th) we’ve proven that we’re committed to equal opportunities and actively promote a diverse and inclusive working environment, and fairness for everyone.

We realise the best people bring their energy at different times, so we’re happy to talk flexible working and offer a range of flexible working options, including full time, part time and job share.

As a Disability Confident Employer we interview every disabled applicant who meet the minimum criteria for the role.

We’ve exciting opportunities for everyone to develop their talent at E.ON. Our open access, inclusive talent networks provide networking, learning and development for all, building your skills, qualifications, and capabilities throughout your career.

E.ON is committed to being an inclusive employer. We recognise that everyone is different and we aim to provide a working environment where each person feels respected, valued and able to achieve their full potential. We are happy to consider flexible working arrangements. If you require any reasonable adjustments, please just let us know.

title: Software Architect
description:
Integration Architect Lead
Here's what you'll be doing

The Integration Architect Lead will be responsible for managing the integration strategy across multiple applications, working closely with our partners to ensure the correct decisions are made about APIs, Event Management Systems, Network Integration and Security.

They will be a technical owner for the API layer, providing guidance and ensuring that our partners are delivering solutions that meet the business requirements.

This role will be a leadership role within a multi team DevOps environment owning the design and structure of the integration layers. It will have visibility of the ongoing costs and ensure decisions are made to optimise the platform.

  • Develop and maintain the integration strategy for E.ON UK Solutions, ensuring that it aligns with the wider E.ON strategies.
  • Work closely with our partners to ensure that the correct decisions are made about APIs, providing guidance and technical expertise where necessary.
  • Collaborate with other architects and stakeholders to design, develop, and implement integration solutions using Mulesoft and Azure API Manager.
  • Establish and maintain best practices and standards for integration architecture and design.
  • Define and maintain an integration roadmap and architecture principles that are aligned with industry best practices.
  • Ensure that the integration solutions are scalable, reliable, and secure.
  • Promote re-use of APIs and ensure that API designs are optimised for re-use
  • Provide technical leadership and guidance to developers and other team members working on behalf of our partners.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot integration issues, ensuring that they are resolved in a timely and effective manner.
  • Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in integration architecture, and provide recommendations for improvement.
What we need from you

Essential

  • Strong background working with integration platforms
  • Experience working within a DevOps & Agile environment
  • Demonstrable hand-on experience of designing and delivering API’s
  • Strong technical leadership and communication skills
  • Experience with Cloud Platforms (AWS, Azure) and related tasks
  • Experience using Mulesoft
  • Good understanding of API security
  • Good technical understanding of Network Integration such as VPNs
  • Experience using an Event Management System such as Kafka
  • Experience working within a multi partner / vendor environment including offshore teams

Desirable

  • Experience of different Integration platforms and their capabilities.
  • Experience of Identity & Access Management solutions and how they operate alongside Integration platforms
  • Understanding of the ITIL framework and how it can be adapted to suit DevOps
  • Experience working with VPNs and associated network protocols
  • Good understanding of ETL & associated tools.
  • Experience of Salesforce Identity.

title: Performance Engineer
description:
Do you have a passion for technology? Do you want to make a difference, delivering software used by some of the biggest companies in the world? Do you love working with others in a dynamic agile environment?
We are looking for enthusiastic, passionate technologists to join our growing team as we strive to deliver excellence to our customers. You're a self starter who will be an integral part of an empowered agile team working on the identity and access management system behind our products such as the Eikon financial information desktop.
The successful applicant will be a talented test engineer or developer able to deliver using various languages and technologies including .net
Writing and executing end-to-end performance tests working within a software delivery team to verify impact of changes.
You will be working in a global organisation with development groups and business stakeholders in several international locations, therefore good communication skills are crucial.
Key Responsibilities
As a member of the IAM development team, your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:
  • Produce, maintain and execute a robust set of automated performance tests to challenging deadlines.
  • Analyse and report on the results of testing.
  • Report and track defects through to completion.
  • Collaborate closely with development teams and product owners within the organisation to understand their requirements of the platform and to support their use of it.
  • Assist in the management, maintenance and monitoring of test environments.
  • You will maintain an understanding of industry trends and use this knowledge to bring new ideas to the platform.
Required Skills
  • Experienced Auto/Performance Tester, with good technical skills (C# .NET preferred)
  • Proven experience in Cloud Technologies (AWS + Azure)
  • Self-starter - does what it takes to get the job done
  • Good problem solver
Desirable Skills
  • Experience of variety of Databases: SQL, NoSQL, GraphDB
  • Suggests process improvement following investigative, analytic or diagnostic services.
  • Responsible for managing own time and responsibilities
  • Sets priorities to meet agreed timescales; develops plans to meet short-term objectives
  • Applies a wide range of policies or standards in straightforward situations
  • Identifies and resolves standard technical and operational problems
  • Decisions involve interpretation of data, planning own work, or refining the methods and techniques to be used
  • Participates in sophisticated projects that affect a Business Unit or regional area
LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth.
Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership, Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions.
Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity.
LSEG offers a range of tailored benefits and support, including healthcare, retirement planning, paid volunteering days and wellbeing initiatives.
We are proud to be an equal opportunities employer. This means that we do not discriminate on the basis of anyone’s race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, veteran status, pregnancy or disability, or any other basis protected under applicable law. Conforming with applicable law, we can reasonably accommodate applicants' and employees' religious practices and beliefs, as well as mental health or physical disability needs.
Please take a moment to read this
privacy notice
carefully, as it describes what personal information London Stock Exchange Group (LSEG) (we) may hold about you, what it’s used for, and how it’s obtained,
your rights and how to contact us as a data subject
.

title: Software Engineer
description:
Date de publication 11/21/2023
Emplacement Nottingham | Royaume-Uni
Entreprise Worldline

Software Developer

Beeston, Nottingham

This is Worldline

We are the innovators at the heart of the payments technology industry, shaping how the world pays and gets paid. The solutions our people build today power the growth of millions of businesses tomorrow. From your local coffee shop to unicorns and international banks. From San Francisco to Auckland. We are in every corner of the world, in every part of commerce. And just as we help our customers accelerate their business, we are committed to helping our people accelerate their careers. Together, we shape the evolution.

The Opportunity

At Worldline, our technology addresses the persistent challenges of the payment world. We design and operate leading digital payment and transactional solutions that enable sustainable economic growth and reinforce trust and security in our societies. If you are a highly skilled Head of Business Development, then get ready to join our company!

We have many hardworking and dedicated peers that would love for you to work with them. We are committed to continuous improvement. We are always looking for new and innovative ways to improve quality, reduce costs, build excellent solutions, and grow customer happiness. We would like to welcome an organized, innovative and process driven colleague to our team.

Day-to-Day Responsibilities

  • Write clean, secure code, following a test-driven approach
  • Collaborate well with peers, both inside and outside of your direct team
  • Develop expertise in the rail retail business and act as a point of contact
  • Participate in on-going training to stay current in required skills.
  • Embrace new technologies and ways of working

Who Are We Looking For

We look for big thinkers. People who can drive positive change, step up and show what’s next – people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. In practice this means:

  • You have good experience in developing RESTful APIs using C# .NET, whilst also getting involved with design decisions
  • You have good experience in cloud concepts such as containerization, AWS Fargate, Lambda, etc
  • You have experience integrating disparate systems
  • You have worked with Azure DevOps (ideally including pipelines)
  • You can design micro and macro services
  • You are inquisitive with a strong desire to learn

Perks & Benefits

At Worldline you’ll get the chance to be at the heart of the global payments technology industry and shape how the world pays and gets paid. On top of that, you will also:

  • Be part of a company guided by a strong purpose to do good and recognized as top 1% of the most sustainable companies in all sectors worldwide
  • Work with inspiring colleagues and be empowered to learn, grow and accelerate your career
  • Have 25 days holiday + bank holidays
  • Have employee private medical cover, access to a virtual GP service
  • Access to discounts and cash backs on shopping *
  • Purchase a range of flexible benefits through salary sacrifice
  • Have an Income protection @ 67% of base salary for 5 years, subject to Ts & Cs
  • Have a Life assurance – 1 x salary if not in a pension scheme, 4 x salary if joins the pension scheme
  • Have Pension – the company will match contributions up to 10%
  • Up to 5 days per year for volunteering
  • Additional time off for family or household emergencies and time off for parents and grandparents to attend school events.

Application Process

We will endeavour to respond to all applicants within 7 working days. If selected, you can expect a screening interview with a recruiter and if moving to the next stage, there will be an interview with a Line Manager.

Shape the evolution

We are on an exciting journey towards the next frontiers of payments technology, and we look for big thinkers, people with passion, can-do attitude and a hunger to learn and grow. Here you’ll work with ambitious colleagues from around the world, take on unique challenges as a team, and make a real impact on the society. With an empowering culture, strong technology and extensive training opportunities, we help you accelerate your career - wherever you decide to go. Join our global team of 18,000 innovators and shape a tomorrow that is yours to own.

Learn more about life at Worldline at careers.worldline.com

We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any applicable legally protected characteristics.

The 18 000 employees of Worldline are all different but share the same values. You can see it in the way we behave. We are curious and humble – we are learning every day, we keep things simple and everyone engaged. In our fast-moving industry, we are adaptable and life-long learners. Everyone demonstrates the same dedication to quality and efficiency. We have an entrepreneurial spirit and sense of service. Above all, we never turn our back on a challenge. These values nurture a dynamic and innovative team where everyone can develop and grow.

title: Commissioning Engineer
description:
Company Description


Join the world of the future in a fast-growing international company! At SEGULA Technologies you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects and help shaping the future within an engineering company which is at the heart of Rail innovation. We cover the entire product development and life cycle - from design, simulation, software and hardware development, through testing and validation, homologation and commissioning, to vehicle and system maintenance.


Job Description


You will be part of a pre-existing team that is responsible for the testing and fault finding for rolling stock vehicles. You will be responsible for preparing the tests and equipment for testing for timely execution of the test program and manage the data analysis of test results, by writing static and dynamic test reports. Previous experience of working within the rail industry in a similar role is essential.

Example systems you will cover:

  • Battery supply
  • Signalling – AWS/TPWS
  • GSMR
  • HVAC
  • Lighting
  • Passenger Auxiliaries
  • Cab Auxiliaries

Qualifications
  • Demonstrable rolling stock vehicle knowledge.
  • Proficient in using computers for diagnostics and software loading.
  • Ability to competently read electrical and mechanical schematics.
  • A strong Mechanical or Electrical background within the rolling stock industry.
  • Relevant NVQ qualification.
  • Confident communicator at all levels (Written and Verbal).
  • Quick thinking, decisive, showing strong initiative and self-determination, good team spirit.

Additional Information
  • Up to 6 month FTC (Inside IR35)
  • Competitive Rates plus Benefits
  • Location: East Midlands
  • Must be eligible to work in the UK
  • Monday to Friday

We are an equal opportunities employer and highly value Diversity and Inclusion.

We encourage, welcome and support applications from People of all genders and cultural backgrounds.

Your application will be reviewed based on your experience, skills and motivations.

Do not hesitate to reach out to us if you need any reasonable adjustments within the recruitment process. We are here to help you be at your best.

title: Data Scientist
description:
At Cromwell we support amazing businesses in the UK and internationally to keep their operations running and people safe, and our goal is to become the easiest company for them to deal with.

We now have a fantastic opportunity available to join us as a Data Scientist within our Data & Insights department.

Purpose of Role

As a problem solver with a creative approach to data solutions & who is passionate about developing successful data solutions, the Data Scientist will work with business stakeholders to implement data-driven projects & workflows within the business.

A successful candidate will have creative approach to data solutions and is passionate about applying data solutions & workflows to enable strategic business decision-making by working with key business stakeholders. This role is perfect for someone who has a proven track-record in the application of data science techniques in a business setting & wants to enhance their skills in a fast-paced business environment.

Role Responsibilities

As a Data Scientist you will be responsible for:

  • Driving data within Cromwell
    • Data set generation, feature engineering & developing ML models that are repeatable, dynamic, and scalable.
    • Supporting with monitoring & maintaining productionised models, identifying, and developing long-term processes, frameworks, tools, methods, and standards.
    • Developing ML models, visualisation tools & analytics to support the business strategy.
    • Advocate and educate on the value of data driven decision making focusing on the “how and why” of solving problems.
  • Managing relationships
    • Engaging with business stakeholders to problem solve with data.
    • Collaborating with the data engineering team to improve data accessibility.
    • Supporting analytics teams to effectively present data-driven insights and recommendations to stakeholders.

Role Requirements

Experience and Knowledge:

  • Degree (or equivalent) Post graduate degree are welcomed.
  • Proficiency in SQL / PostgreSQL / Microsoft SQL / Oracle
  • Proficient in Python or R
  • Proven business experience (1+ years) within a data scientist role, solving problems through data.
  • Good understanding of machine learning modelling techniques & proven experience deploying these within a business
  • Adept in in statistics and experience of using statistical techniques
  • Experience of analysing large datasets and communicating complex algorithms and methodologies to key technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • A detail oriented, highly logical, and creative problem solver with a passion for overcoming complex challenges.
  • Proficient in writing clear, maintainable code

Highly Desirable

title: Operations Engineer
description:
No matter where you are in your career – or where you want to be – we’re here to create a great place to work where you can grow, perform and love what you do. At Cromwell, we’re all individuals, with unique backgrounds and personalities. But we have one thing in common: delivering exceptional service for our customers. And we do this through our purpose of Keeping Industry Working.

We now have a fantastic opportunity available to join us as an ML Ops Engineer within our Data, Digital & Technology department.

As ML Ops Engineer you will be leveraging and operationalising machine learning (ML) effectively. You will support the architectural needs of our Data Science team to ensure the seamless deployment, monitoring, and maintenance of machine learning models and data pipelines.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Close collaboration with the Data Science team to design and implement scalable and reliable infrastructure for machine learning model deployment and data processing.
  • Deploy machine learning models and data pipelines to production environments and establish robust monitoring and alerting systems to ensure optimal performance and reliability.
  • Develop and maintain automation scripts and tools to streamline the ML model deployment process and ensure reproducibility.
  • Implement security best practices and ensure compliance with relevant data privacy regulations in all ML Ops processes.
  • Work cross-functionally with Data Scientists, Software Engineers and DevOps team members to facilitate efficient model development, testing, and deployment.
  • Proactively identify and resolve issues related to ML model performance, data pipelines, and infrastructure, ensuring minimal downtime.
  • Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for ML Ops processes, configurations, and best practices.

Qualifications:

    • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master's preferred).
    • Proven experience in ML Ops, DevOps, or a similar role, with a focus on deploying and maintaining machine learning models.
    • Proficiency in containerization technologies (e.g., Docker) and orchestration tools (e.g. Kubernetes).
    • Strong scripting and automation skills (e.g. Python, Bash).
    • Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS, Azure, GCP) and infrastructure-as-code (e.g. Terraform).
    • Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and version control systems (e.g. Git).
    • Understanding of data science workflows and machine learning frameworks (e.g. TensorFlow, PyTorch).
    • Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.
    • Strong teamwork and collaboration abilities

As a leader in B2B and B2C e-commerce, our Digital team is responsible for driving digital multi-channel solutions that make it easy for customers to deal with us.

At Cromwell we support amazing businesses in the UK and internationally to keep their operations running and people safe, and our goal is to become the easiest company for them to deal with

title: Veterinarian
description:
Posted on 31/10/2023

Stud Vet – Mat Cover
Oakham Veterinary Hospital, Equine
Up to £63,000 pro rata subject to experience



We are looking to recruit an experienced equine stud vet for the 2024 breeding season with experience of:
  • AI with fresh, chilled and frozen semen
  • Embryo Transfer work
  • Semen collection and processing
  • Neonatal foal care

We are a busy AI centre with a varied client base serving both amateur and professional breeders.

Ideally the successful candidate will have a minimum of 3 years’ experience in stud work. We need a dynamic team player, who possesses the ambition and enthusiasm to contribute to our reputation and can offer the best possible service to our clients.

40 hours per week, flexible work pattern possible, no OOH rota requirement during stud season from April to August, but successful applicant would be expected to fulfil weekend stud work as required with support from other team members. Out of stud season you would be expected to join the OOH rota for evenings/weekends.

Mobile digital imaging equipment is available for working up ambulatory cases and you will be supported by the team at our referral hospital with excellent facilities including MRI, Scintigraphy and CT.

With a start date of March 2024, ideally we would like to recruit a candidate who can fulfil the stud role from April to August and continue as part of our ambulatory team for the rest of the year, however for the right candidate we are open to it being a stud season only role.


Find a place to grow

Oakham Veterinary Hospital is a long-established practice on the outskirts of Oakham, Rutland. Our premises are purpose built and set in 8.5 acres surrounded by rural countryside, with easy access to main transport links.

We are very proud to have accredited hospital status by the RCVS (Royal College of Veterinary Surgeons) and offer a complete veterinary service from routine vaccinations to specialist surgery and diagnostic imaging. We also have a clinical association with The University of Nottingham School of Veterinary Medicine and Science giving us access to leading specialists at the vet school on a daily basis.



Meet like-minded professionals

The hospital team is led by our 3 clinical directors who are supported by a team of 5 assistant vets, 3 interns and 10 nurses. We have two in house surgeons along with a surgical resident. In addition we also have a clinical association with The University of Nottingham School of Veterinary Medicine and Science meaning we have vets permanently based with us that provide veterinary care in both medicine and sport horse medicine.

The clinical staff are supported by a team of 6 office staff, a lab technician, HR manager and the equine practice director.

The successful candidate will have the back-up of our expert hospital teams – diploma holders, certified surgeons, residents, interns- and our dedicated, qualified nursing staff.



Because our employees matter

We recognise that our people are fundamental to the success of our business. Investing in our people, premises and processes is at the heart of what we do. In addition to a competitive base salary, you will benefit from -

Work-life balance
  • 6.6 weeks annual leave
  • Your birthday as a paid day off

Wellbeing
  • Private medical insurance
  • Enhanced family-friendly policies, including maternity/paternity/adoption/shared parental and surrogacy pay
  • Cycle to Work scheme
  • Initiatives focused on employee wellbeing
  • Non-accidental injury support

Development
  • £1500 CPD allowance with 40 hours paid pro rata
  • Certificate support
  • Learning and development opportunities via the IVC Evidensia Academy
  • Access to Vetlexicon – our online encyclopaedia provider
  • All our Vets & Nurses can apply for research funding
  • All our Vets get £1000 per annum to spend via our Care Fund
  • Infection Prevention and Control Programme
  • Quality Improvement Programme

Professional Memberships
  • BVA membership
  • VDS cover
  • RCVS fees

Additional
  • Pawsome Benefits – reward gateway giving discounts and cashback with 100’s of retailers
  • Pension – 5% Employee/3% Employer
  • Discounted staff pet care

For a confidential chat or to discuss this role in more detail, please contact Jim Dixon, Talent Partner, on jim.dixon@ivcevidensia.com / 07890610129 or Matthew Hecking, Practice Director and Stud Manager at OVH at matthew.hecking@oakhamvethospital.co.uk/07976 822903

Any questions before applying?

Speak to Jim Dixon from our recruitment team who would be happy to help you with any questions you have before applying for this role.

Jim Dixon

Talent Partner

jim.Dixon@ivcevidensia.com+44 (0) 7890 610 129

description:

title: Cloud Engineer
description:
Job Advert

AIX Cloud Engineer

Location: Remote

£55,000-£60,000, plus car / car allowance, 33 days holiday, pension, bonus, life assurance, employee assistance programme, wellbeing support, and flexible benefits scheme


About the Job


As an AIX Cloud Engineer, you will be a vital member of Unipart Logistics' IT team, responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of AIX cloud solutions, particularly in the context of IBM Cloud. Your role will focus on ensuring the reliable, secure, and efficient operation of AIX-based infrastructure in a cloud environment, including the use of GLVM (Global Logical Volume Manager) technology.


As part of your key responsibilities you’ll:


  • Design, deploy, and manage AIX cloud solutions in IBM Cloud to support business objectives, ensuring high availability and scalability
  • Collaborate closely with various teams, including IT, Operations, and Finance, to develop and implement cost-effective AIX cloud designs and architectures in an IBM Cloud environment
  • Maintain, upgrade and optimize AIX cloud environments in IBM Cloud, ensuring security, performance, and compliance with industry standards, including the use of GLVM technology
  • Provide technical support for AIX-based systems in IBM Cloud and resolve issues promptly and effectively
  • Document system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting guides
  • Contribute to disaster recovery and business continuity planning for AIX cloud resources in IBM Cloud
  • Stay informed about emerging technologies and best practices in cloud engineering, AIX administration, and related areas, with a focus on IBM Cloud and GLVM
  • Participate in capacity planning and performance tuning of AIX cloud resources in IBM Cloud
  • Clustering technologies (preferably PowerHA)
  • Automation experience
  • Scripting experience (eg: ksh, bash)


About You


We’d love you to have the following skills and experience, but please apply if you think you’d be able to perform well in this role!


  • Strong team player
  • Experience migrating and deploying cloud based solutions (AWS/IBM Cloud preferred)
  • Experience with deploying cloud based solutions and workload migration strategy using tools, Linux Operating System


Our recruitment and selection process has been developed to ensure that it is consistent, fair and provides equality of opportunity - all selection decisions are based solely on technical and behavioural competencies. We do not discriminate on the grounds of race, colour, or nationality, ethnic or national origins, sex, gender reassignment, sexual orientation, marital or civil partnership status, pregnancy or maternity, disability, religion or belief, age or any other current or future protected characteristic as defined in the current Equality Act of England and Wales. As an organisation we also promote an environment which encourages diversity of characteristics and thought, where you feel included, safe and confident to be the best version of yourself and do your best work every day.

title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Our talented people are creating the technology of the future.

Tracsis’ purpose is to empower the world to move freely, safely and sustainably. Our approach focuses on combining leading edge software and hardware knowledge, data capture, analytics and industry expertise to generate insights and fast-to-market products and services.

MPEC Technology, who are part of the Tracsis group, is the leading supplier of condition monitoring hardware and software to the UK railway and has helped make Britain’s railways safer and more reliable. We get to work with technology as old as mechanical signalling, right through to the latest artificial intelligence and machine learning algorithms.

What you will do..

You will be joining our growing team of enterprise software engineers to deliver the Centrix web application which receives, analyses and presents data from our IOT devices. This platform processes billions of data events from across the UK and worldwide; providing near real-time monitoring and fault alerting for a variety of railway assets.

As a member of the enterprise development team, you will be responsible for designing and implementing new features, collaborating as part of an agile team.

  • Web concepts such as HTTP, REST, JSON.
  • Experience with frontend development

  • Frontend JavaScript framework(s) e.g. Angular, React etc.

Tech Stack

  • SQL / relational database
  • Hibernate
  • Typescript / Javascript
  • AngularJS Framework
  • HTML + CSS / LESS
  • Git

What we will offer you..

title: Fpga Engineer

you will contribute to the creation of customized software toolsets that support the firmware development for our equipment. These innovative solutions are meticulously crafted to meet the demanding standards of rigorous safety requirements.

title: Instrumentation Engineer
description:
Job Description

EC&I Engineer - Technologies

Full Time, Hybrid

Derby

Why Rolls-Royce?

An exciting opportunity has arisen for an Electrical, Control & Instrumentation (EC&I) Engineer to join our Electrical Controls and Instrumentation Systems and Safety Department at Rolls-Royce Submarines.

We’re a leader in propulsion system design and development for the Royal Navy’s nuclear submarine fleet and the sole provider and technical authority.

Join us and we’ll provide an environment where you can be yourself. An inclusive, digital-first culture that invests in you, gives you a platform for continuous learning, and access to an incredible breadth and depth of opportunities to grow your career.

As well as developing the system design, safety case and information assurance case for the EC&I systems for the Dreadnought and other classes of submarines, the EC&I Systems and Safety team also manages the EC&I technology strategy and technology development programme. You will be involved in development of technologies to support future class submarine EC&I systems as well as the wider Submarines business.

We offer excellent development, a competitive salary and exceptional benefits. These include bonus, employee support assistance and employee discounts.

Your needs are as unique as you are. Hybrid working is a way in which our people can balance their time between the office, home or another remote location. It’s a locally managed and flexed informal discretionary arrangement. As a minimum we’re all expected to attend the workplace for collaboration and other specific reasons, on average three days per week

What you will be doing:

You will be working as part of the EC&I Technologies team, supporting R&T programmes with responsibilities that include:

  • Undertaking stakeholder engagement and requirements elicitation activities.
  • Developing EC&I technologies from concept to prototype. This will involve specifying, developing, prototyping, validating and delivering technology solutions in the context of highly challenging applications.
  • Developing high quality system models and machine learning models for use in safety critical applications
  • Horizon Scanning to identify and assess emerging technologies from external sources across various technology domains.
  • Preparing technical reports and documentation to a standard compatible with engineering best practice.

Who we’re looking for:

At Rolls-Royce we embrace agility, are bold, pursue collaboration and seek simplicity in everything we do. These principles form our values and behaviours and are an essential component of our assessment process and are fundamental qualities that we seek for all roles.

Required:

  • HND / Bachelor's degree in a relevant engineering discipline or equivalent level of continuous professional development and experience.
  • Experience in requirements capture/analysis and other aspects of Systems Engineering.
  • A good understanding of the product design lifecycle.
  • Professional attitude and strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills.

Preferable:

  • Technical understanding of electrical/electronic/C&I systems.
  • Experience in the nuclear sector or another highly regulated industry.
  • Understanding and ideally practical experience with C, C++ and Python.
  • Experience with machine learning tools/frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
  • Experience with Model Based Systems Engineering and Mathworks tools (Simulink and MATLAB).

We are an equal opportunities employer. We’re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful we’ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realise their full potential.

You can learn more about our global Inclusion strategy at careers.rolls-royce.com

To work for Rolls-Royce Submarines you need to hold a Security Check (SC) clearance without any caveats to that clearance. Rolls-Royce will support the application for Security Clearance if you don’t currently already have this in place. Due to the nature of work the business conducts and the protection of certain assets, you must hold a UK nationality. Any dual nationals will require additional scrutiny and background checks prior to commencing work with RRSL.

Closing date:19th February 2024
